spans.content: Question 1.03
Here are the equity accounts of a foreign company whose currency is CUR.
This company is consolidated by the global integration method with an indirect financial percentage of
Rates 1.3 and 1.4 are historical rates.
What is the contribution of the company in the « Translation adjustments » account in the consolidated equity?
Question 1.04
The evolution of the Tangible assets account of a foreign company is given here below in local currency CUR.
The rate 0.5 is the closing rate to apply for the opening value and 0.7 for the closing value.
The Acquisitions and Disposals flows are translated at the average rate 0.6.
What will be the value of the Translation adjustment flow after currency conversion?
DIRECT CONSOLIDATION
Question 1.05
A group consists in a parent company P owning directly three companies: A, B and C with financial percentages and consolidated with consolidation methods as presented hereunder.
The statutory closing value of the Bank account of each of these companies is also given here.
What will be the consolidated value of this Bank account?
Question 1.06
Company P consolidates A and B by the global integration method.
Total equity of companies A and B and the financial investment from A in B are given here below.

spans.html:
Total equity of A1,000
Financial investment from A in B800
Total equity of B1,000

spans.content: What will be the value of the Minority interests account in the consolidated balance sheet?
PART 7 CONSOLIDATION QUIZZ
Question 1.07
The structure of this group remains unchanged in Year 1 and Year 2.
Company B is a foreign company with currency CUR.
At the end of Year 1, company B decides to pay dividends of 1000 CUR and local laws require company B to withhold a tax of
on these dividends.
Company A receives a cash amount of 525 CUR = 70% * [75% * 1000 CUR] which corresponds to 470 EUR on the Bank receipt and book for that amount on the Financial income account.
Last information: average rate of currency CUR of Year 1 is 0.8 and of Year 2 is 0.7.
What is the amount of dividends to eliminate in company A accounts, that is to transfer from profit to reserves?
Question 1.08
A company P acquires
of shares of a company A for a price of 1000.
At the date of acquisition, company A total statutory equity is 800 and, after the due diligence process, it is decided to reevaluate a building for 200.
If this transaction leads to a goodwill, what would be its value?
DIRECT CONSOLIDATION
Question 1.09
Here is the consolidated P&L of a group.

spans.html:
Turnover2,000
Cost of sales(1,600)
Depreciations(200)
Provisions(100)
Financial income150
Profit from equity method comp50
Consolidated profit300
3rd Parties profit60
Group profit240

spans.content: What is the consolidated cash flow statement of this group?
Question 1.10
A few years ago, the following consolidation adjustment has been booked in local currency in a company consolidated by the proportional method at
For this consolidation, the closing rate was 2.3 and the average rate 2.5.
This year, the adjustment is maintained in the consolidation and the closing and average rates are 1.8 and 1.7 respectively.
What is the contribution of the adjustment in the consolidated Translation adjustment account?
PART 7 CONSOLIDATION QUIZZ
2 QUIZZ 2
Question 2.01
We consider the three following companies belonging to a consolidation scope, with their consolidation method as specified here below.

spans.html:
Company PConsolidating company
Company AGlobal integration
Company BEquity method

spans.content: We also give the Payables account of each company, with the intercompany details.

spans.html:
Company P3rd parties500
Company A200
Company B300
Company A3rd parties700
Company P100
Company B3rd parties100
Company P400

spans.content: Supposing all intercompany accounts are correctly reconciled, what will be the consolidated value of this Payables account?
DIRECT CONSOLIDATION
Question 2.02
At the beginning of the year, company A is owned with a financial percentage of
On July 1
^{\text{st}}
, the group sells
of shares and company A is now owned at
The 12 months statutory profit of 200 splits into 120 for the first half year and 80 for the second half year.
Moreover, there is a consolidation adjustment booked for 40 corresponding to an additional depreciation.
What is the contribution of the company in the consolidated profit of the group?
Question 2.03
Parent company P owns
of company A, for a statutory value of 1000.
P decides to sell
of its participation to
3^{\text{rd}}
Parties for a price of 400, making a gain of 150.
At the date of disposal, the company A total adjusted equity is 1500.
What will be the amount of the consolidation adjustment correcting the statutory gain in P&L?

Question 2.04
In this group,
\mathsf{P}
is the consolidating company and
\mathsf{A}, \mathsf{B}
and
\mathsf{C}
are consolidated with the global integration method.
Here below is some information on some accounts. All amounts are in consolidation currency.

spans.html:
Total equity of A2,000
Total equity of B1,000
Total equity of C1,000
Financial investment from A in B900
Financial investment from B in C700

spans.content: What is the amount of Minority interests in the consolidated equity?
Question 2.05
We show below the statutory equity of the consolidating company and the consolidated equity of its group.
Considering these figures, which of the four following proposals is the correct one?

spans.html:
aIf Reserves are negative (Debit), it should be the same for Minority interests
bAt least one company is making more losses than profits since its first consolidation
cReserves cannot be negative (debit)
dConsolidated equity is always greater than statutory equity of parent company

spans.content: DIRECT CONSOLIDATION
Question 2.06
In this group,
- P pays dividends of 300
A pays dividends of 200
B pays dividends of 100
These dividends are all related to previous year, paid and booked in the corresponding Financial income accounts during the first months of this year.
What will be the total amount of dividends paid in the consolidated cash flow statement?
Question 2.07
Company A is consolidated by the equity method with a percentage of

This company decides to increase its capital by 1000 and each shareholder subscribes with respect to its participation percentage. Thus, the parent company subscribes 300 and the other shareholders, all together, subscribe 700.
What will be the amount appearing in the consolidated cash flow statement concerning this capital increase?
PART 7 CONSOLIDATION QUIZZ
Question 2.08
We consider a group of two companies, the consolidating company P and a subsidiary A owned at
(global integration).
Here is the consolidated reserves evolution report.
Which of the following proposals is not correct?

spans.html:
aA pays a gross dividend of 125
bP pays a gross dividend of 200
cThis report is technically correct
dA pays an interim dividend of 150

of company A and the statutory book value of this participation is 1000. Company A statutory equity is 2000.
